result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Staples was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all of the following  the end of supervison. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  
Restitution in amount of $2,370.00 to Nediyon, joint and several; all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment/vocation in any combination equaling full time hours.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with Nediyon D.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Joshua J Staples in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Joshua J Staples in custody.  
Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS with 66 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment/ education/vocation; in any combination equaling full-time hours.
- No contact with: Nediyon D. 
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $2370 to Nediyon D. joint and several; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.

- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence-copy to defendant;
Victim Impact Statement;   
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.
Letter and documentation from defendant received and filed.
Letter in Support of the Defendant received and filed.

Defendant Joshua J Staples in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Joshua J Staples in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES the defense motion for bail reduction.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua J Staples in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Joshua J Staples in custody.  Ronald Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Tracy Becker-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nediyon D or his residence

Defendant Joshua J Staples in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Joshua J Staples in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).



  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
